1.text: Let not your heart be troubled: believe in God, and believe in me.

2.text: In my Fatherâ€™s house are many dwellings: and if not, I had said to you. I go to prepare a place for you.

3.text: And if I go and prepare a place for you, again I come, and I will receive you to myself; that where I am, ye might be also.

4.text: And where I retire ye know, and the way ye know.

5.text: Thomas says to him, Lord, we know not where thou retirest; and how can we know the way?

6.text: Jesus says to him, I am the way, and the truth, and the life: no one comes to the Father, except by me.

7.text: If ye had known me, ye had also known my Father: and from now ye know, and have seen him.

8.text: Philip says to him, Lord, show us the Father, and it suffices us.

9.text: Jesus says, to him, So long time am I with you, and hast thou not known me, Philip? he having seen me has seen the Father; and how sayest thou, Show us the Father?

10.text: Believest thou not that I in the Father, and the Father is in me? the words which I speak to you, I speak not of myself: and the Father remaining in me does the works.

11.text: Believe ye me that I in the Father, and the Father in me: and if not, for these works believe me.

12.text: Truly, truly, I say to you, He believing in me, the works which I do shall he do also; and greater than these shall he do; for I go to my Father.

13.text: And whatever ye ask in my name, this will I do, that the Father might be honoured by the Son.

14.text: If ye ask anything in my name, I will do.

15.text: If ye love me, keep my commands.

16.text: And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Intercessor, that should remain with you forever;

17.text: The Spirit of truth; which the world cannot receive, for it sees it not, neither knows: and ye know it; for it shall remain with you, and shall be in you.

18.text: I will not leave you orphans; I come to you.

19.text: Yet a little, and the world sees me no more; and ye see me: because I live, ye shall live also.

20.text: In that day shall ye know that I am in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.

21.text: He having my commands, and keeping them, the same is he loving me: and he loving me shall be loved by my Father, and I will love him, and manifest myself to him.

22.text: Judas says to him, not Iscariot, Lord, how has it been that thou art about to make thyself manifest to us, and not to the world?

23.text: Jesus answered and said to him, If any one love me, he will keep my word: and my Father will love him, and we will come to him, and we will make our stay with him.

24.text: He not loving me will not keep my words: and the word which ye hear is not of me, but of the Father having sent me.

25.text: These have I spoken to you, remaining with you.

26.text: But the Intercessor, the Holy Spirit, which the Father will send in my name, the same shall teach you all things, and he shall remind you of all things which I spake to you.

27.text: Peace I leave to you, my peace I give to you: not as the world gives, give I to you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be timid.

28.text: Ye have heard that I said to you, I retire, and I am coming to you. If ye loved me, ye would rejoice because I said, I go to the Father: for my Father is greater than I.

29.text: And now have I told you before it shall be, that when it should be, ye might believe.

30.text: I will no more speak much with you: for the ruler of this world comes, and has nothing in me.

31.text: But that the world might know that I love the Father, and as the Father commanded me, so I do. Arise ye, let us go thence.
